faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders vastgoed kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without residency requirements or citizenship restrictions. UK and EU citizens face no additional barriers. Non-EU buyers may encounter marginally longer administrative processes but face no legal prohibition. Most transactions involve standard conveyancing similar to UK property purchase, with professional legal representation recommended.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van het kopen van vastgoed in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-12% of property price. These include transfer tax (6-7%), notary fees (1-2%), and conveyancing/legal fees (1-2%). No UK-style stamp duty exists. Once purchased, annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-1.1% of property value. Utility costs (electricity, water, gas) average €80-120 monthly, significantly lower than UK equivalents.

faqs.question: What rental income potential exists for this property?

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, UK and EU citizens can obtain Spanish mortgages through Spanish banks. Typical loan-to-value ratios reach 80%, with interest rates currently 3.5-4.5%. British banks occasionally support Spanish property mortgages. Mortgage applications require proof of income and financial stability. Many investors combine Spanish mortgages with UK remortgage equity access for property portfolio expansion.

faqs.question: What tax implications exist for Spanish property ownership?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-1.1% of property value. Rental income is subject to Spanish income tax (approximately 19% of net rental income for non-residents). Capital gains tax applies at sale (approximately 19% for non-residents). UK tax residents typically include Spanish rental income in UK tax returns with foreign tax credits. Professional accountancy support ensures compliance and optimization.
